choices.B: Raise an exception report to manage the impact that any such delay would have on the project plan.
choices.A: Add appropriate activities to the project plan to manage the concern and avoid any adverse impact.
choices.D: Add the information to the risk register so that it can be evaluated and an action decided.
choices.C: Raise an issue report so that the trainers' time can be allocated to the accreditation activities.

questions.question_text:
The senior user is concerned that the trainers' limited availability could delay their accreditation. This was discussed during the 'starting up a project' process, but during the 'initiating a project' process the project manager notices that it has not been recorded.
Which action should the project manager take FIRST?

discussion.content: Correct Answer should be D - Page 226 Section 17.4.6

Selected Answer: D
D) When a concern or issue arises that hasn't been formally recorded yet, the first step is to treat it as a potential risk, and should be documented in the risk register so that they can be evaluated and assessed properly.

Selected Answer: D
The identified risk need to be registered and then assessed and action planned.

D. Add the information to the risk register so that it can be evaluated and an action decided.

In PRINCE2, when a concern or issue is identified, the first step is typically to record it in the risk register. This allows for a structured evaluation of the concern, including its potential impact, probability, and any potential mitigation or response actions.

Selected Answer: D
This is clearly a risk as the impact is not certain. First risks need to be identified and assessed and only after we can plan how to cope with them.

Selected Answer: A
The question states it is during the initiating a project process.
Page 208 section 16.4.7 for 'Create the project plan', "identify and confirm resources required. Confirm the selected people's availability".

choices.C: Select the project approach and assemble the project brief
choices.A: Design and appoint the Project Management Team

questions.question_text: During which of the following activities is the Project Product Description created?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D) I would go for option D - Plan the initiation stage

Ref. AI bots
In PRINCE2, the Project Product Description is created during the "Initiating a Project" process, specifically as part of "Plan the Initiation Stage".

This activity takes place after the project has been authorized but before the project moves into full execution. The Project Product Description provides a clear and detailed description of the project's deliverables and sets out the quality criteria and expectations for the product(s) being delivered. It ensures that all stakeholders have a shared understanding of what the project aims to produce.

C. Select the project approach and assemble the project brief

The Project Product Description is created during the "Select the project approach and assemble the project brief" activity, which is part of the Starting Up a Project process.

The wiki states:

"The assembled Project Brief includes...the Project Product Description. This is a high-level description of what the products requirements are."

B seems the most appropriate as the Project Management Team is designed and appointed during the Starting Up a Project process; but question is not so clear as also products and scope need to be to some extent understood in the Starting Up a Project process while compiling the Project Brief.

comments.content:
16.2 refers the below as an objective of 'Initiating a project process' 
The scope of what is to be done and the products to be delivered

choices.C: Understand how quality required will be achieved
choices.A: Understanding the scope of what is to be done and the products to be delivered
choices.B: Understanding the roles and responsibilities of the Project Management Team
choices.D: Understand how progress will be monitored and controlled

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an objective of Initiating a Project?

discussion.content:
In PRINCE2, when the Business Case is updated during the Initiating a Project process, the Benefits Review Plan is also created.

The purposes are:

Business Case - To re-validate the reasons for doing the project
Benefits Review Plan - To define how project benefits will be measured

Figure 16.9 (p209) shows that the Benefits Management Approach is Created and the same time the Detailed Business Case is created (so the original Business Case is updated to make it the Detailed one).
I think it should be "Update the benefits management approach" - Page 418 19.4.3

questions.question_text: Which other management product is created when the Business case is updated during Initiating a Project?
Who is responsible for the initial creation of the Configuration Item records?

discussion.content:
A

Initial creation is done by the Project Manager
Maintenance and updates are done by the Team Manager throughout the project
Project Support provides administrative assistance by storing, filing, and retrieving Configuration Item Records as needed. They provide support to the Project Manager and Team Manager.
